Reviews.Title: “No a/c in my 100 sq ft room.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMom201
Reviews.Content: Not a lot to offer here. Typical tiny, old, European digs with creaky floors, paper thin walls, and 12 TV channels (CNN and BBC were my saving grace). Unless you need to be in that area, stay at hotel Zenit Borrell instead. Better facility and cheaper prices.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but very unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: RuthPasq
Reviews.Content: The hotel it self it’s nice, but we were very disappointed by the staff. I ask at the kitchen staff to give me a glass of hot water to take medication and I received hot water from the tap. Early in the morning the lady cleaners weak us up by the noise they made. When we asked to keep quiet as we were still sleeping, they were indeed very rude (the spanish woman, well groomed and full of make-up was indeed a person that will need serious training on how to treat guests). We enjoyed visiting Barcelona, but we didn't appreciate this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average and certainly good value for money”
Reviews.Author: katie s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work- I have stayed at places a million times worse ( travelodge) so i was quite thrilled at the exterior and interior of the hotel and the rooms, i thought it was extremly clean, lovely furniture...i would recommend this to anyone work or tourist, the location is wonderful as well in a really affluent area near the uni lots of lovely shops, cafes and delhis and about 1 min from Maria Christina subway stop so an ideal distance from the city with lots of lovely places in between e.g. Diagonal - just learn spanish as the desk workers english isnt fantastic, which is fine but tricky!!!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Photos”
Reviews.Author: 913nyctraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently and was flabbergasted at how plain and old the room furnishings were, something like you would expect in a bedroom from the 1950s except that I think the bedspread actually is from the 50s. If there are rooms in the hotel that look like this photo, I didn't have one. In a city full of beautiful hotels, this was a terrible disappointment. Nevertheless, the bathrooms did appear newer and everything was clean. My room was blissfully quiet and the bed very firm. Breakfast was pleasant and substantial enough and the staff were helpful. They did miss my wake up call, though, on an important day. Not 4 star by American standards at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star and weak air con, but comfortable with clean rooms and lovely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: katedee_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and baby and we got a cheap deal online. After reading some reviews, we expected it not to be too flash. The furniture and decor is tired and old and the air conditioning is poor (not split system -centrally controlled and even on high is not very powerful) however when we complained as we had a hot baby, they provided a fan for the room which helped. Buffet breakfast and wifi was free, although the wifi required you to log back in frequently. The buffet was basic but tasty - toast, eggs, bacon, sausages, pastries, cereal, yoghurt, filter coffee etc. The room service menu was definitely basic with no vegetarian options (apart from one green salad) and so the hotel staff provided us with a pizza/pasta menu that was delivered and charged to our hotel bill - average pizza but at least it was another option as we were in the room a lot at night due to having a small baby with us. Overall a pretty basic hotel, however I found the rooms clean, the staff helpful and if you get a good deal on your room, worth staying there. Noise was not a problem for us and the location was good - close to metro and a little out of the centre of town so quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Very good reception staff and manager - nice location”
Reviews.Author: MinouDelCairo
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to thank Atika, Isaac, Juanjo and Lluis for being always helpful and friendly. Also the blonde lady 'maybe the manager' who always made sure that our requests were met. The location is good -not the best- for it's a 5 min walk to Maria Cristina metro station and Ave. Diagonal. A quite area good foe business and near to Princesa Sofia hotel -where the conferences are held- There are two shopping malls (Pedralbes and L'Illa), il corte ingles, H&M and some coffee shops and restaurants. Away from the touristic area and calm. The room was ok for the price though the a/c couldn't be reset. The bed was comfy. The breakfast was basic but fine. The staff in general are professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if AC Suite or Princess Sofia have availability!”
Reviews.Author: emmanuel137
Reviews.Content: Just a short trip but nowhere near as good as the two other hotels mentioned in the title where I have stayed recently. Yes, it's a few Euros cheaper but you can really tell. Everything from the lifts to the rooms have a cheap feel to them and it was unbelievably noisy. If you stay here, take earplugs with you or do what we did and go to a local pharmacy and buy some. It's described as a four star hotel, but by UK standards it's like a Travelodge (actually, many Travelodges I've stayed in are far superior to this one). If you want a bed for the night and have earplugs, then stay here. If you want your hotel to be part of your Barcelpoa experience, then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Old fascion”
Reviews.Author: slyfly
Reviews.Content: The furniture is very old The breakfast is poor. The service is very far away from a real 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “survivable but be prepared for surprises”
Reviews.Author: behemoth0922
Reviews.Content: Staff seem to be trying their best but have limited qualification, and management cuts too many corners. It is all true about thin walls and coughing in the next room. Don't expect bathrobes or slippers to be provided. Hygiene is dubious, e.g. bed covers are apparently washed, but old soils are still there, and some of the rooms are full of unpleasant smells of unclear origin. Some of the furniture is rather dated. Don't be surprised that a room allegedly for two people will only have one chair. The safebox is small: you will not be able to put there your laptop, only passport or jewellery. Wifi did not work one day but was ok on others (don't rely on watching movies over the net, though). Breakfasts are tolerable but nothing special. On the plus side, laundry and ironing done the same day. Overall, the level of comfort and service feels more like 3-star than 4-star.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel: bad wifi, thin walls, mixed service”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a conference in Barcelona. Location was great, near diagonal and near my conf. The hotel is listed as 4 stars but IMO it barely deserved a 3 star rating. The rooms have hardwood floors which is nice, but the rest of the room is lacking. Bed was large - two twins pushed together to make a giant king bed. However the mattress was very hard. My room had a bedspread with a large brown stain - at least 12 inches across. I noticed that housekeeping replaced the spread in the middle of my stay but why was it there in the first place? The sheets however seemed quite clean. Room had thin walls I could hear everything in the next door room including someone talking to family in the US at 2am - every word. Hotel wifi is terrible it was completely out for about 12 hours from 9am until the evening. Breakfast was actually pretty good lots of choices but it is buffet. There is no meals to be had at lunch time. And dinner only has room service with a very limited menu and hours. Compared to 4 star hotels I have stayed at in London and Paris I would put this one definitively below those - it seems to rate about a 3 star at best. The lack of continual room service or dining room and the poor wifi are not 4 star and the gym in the basement is very limited - it would hardly qualify at a decent hotel in the US. The hotel was not as good as a 3 star hotel I recently stayed at in Edinburgh.

Reviews.Title: “Charged for wifi, old and crappy”
Reviews.Author: sharkwithalaser
Reviews.Content: Charged $20 for wifi that did not even work. Rooms were old and crappy, nothing like the pictures. Would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Martina91
Reviews.Content: This is meant to be a 4 star hotel. When we arrived the member of staff that checked us in hardly looked at us and didn't even tell us where our room was. The rooms are average and we had a superior room that was meant to cost an extra €50.00. But the worst part was the breakfast. We thought that it was included in the price but it was an extra €13.00 each. I have thrown better in the bin. I could not even get a cup of tea. I recommend not paying them the money for BK and going across the road to the bakery. This hotel is really not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but not great”
Reviews.Author: TexasJpr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. The food is fair and the service is good. Breakfast is 13 Euros. If you aren't very hungry, there is a bakery across the street which is cheap and very good. There is a Cafe Restaurant across and up the street which is also very good. You can hear the people next door cough.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!”
Reviews.Author: luisJaen_Spain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Husa Arenas in June 2008. Staff and food were okay. The worst part was: they never informed us that the A/C was not working. I thought I did not know how to manage the A/C buttoms and was embarrassed to call reception... then, they let us know the A/C was broken up and unsure when it would go....indeed, it never worked out during the three-day stay and no alternative hotel or any compensation was provided. As a result, we had to sleep with opened windows and being awaken at 6am because of the sun and traffic noise (and by the way, very noise rooms). I agree...not a 4-star hotel..if it was in the past, not now. Quite far from the centre as well. Not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is good, everything else, less so...”
Reviews.Author: jiminlondon
Reviews.Content: The breakfast here is indeed very good and possibly one of the best I have had in Spain (admittedly given the English appetite at breakfast that's not saying much!) However I agree with the other reviewers in that it is simply way too noisy- I stayed in a first floor room over the reception and could here people coming and going all night. Also I thought the rooms were a bit dirty (I was there for four nights and my towel was never changed) and I found it too far out of the city center... The staff were nice though...

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Husa Arenas in Dec 2005. Staff were excellent, Food was good Rooms are very very noisy. Paper thin walls, you can hear people in next room talking, clearly. Bathroom ventilator shaft goes right through to bathroom next door and you can actually see into their bathroom!! When someone else in the hotel runs a bath everyone gets to hear it!! The noisiest room we've ever stayed in. Oh and the beds are rock hard. and its a very long way from the centre. 30mins on tube or 20 mins by taxi

HotelInfo.Name: Husa Arenas
HotelInfo.Address: Capitan Arenas 20, 08034 Barcelona, Spain
